stream_context.summary: Kaze blocks-out and tests the new “Snowman Cave” portion of the Ice Castle (Course 11).  He iterates on platform layouts, enemy behaviour, elevator feel and screen shake, while discussing upcoming optimisation work, demo plans and team roles.

development_findings.summary: Current focus is designing four distinct rooms for Snowman Cave: a climbable slide attacked by snowmen, a void-platform section, a cliff-climb and a treasure/end room with coins and a star.
development_findings.quote: So today our mission is to do the snowman cave … One room I want is kind of like a slide that you climb up … Another one is platforms over a void … There could be a room that’s mostly cliffs going up.

development_findings.summary: Shadows will become a separate object so they can independently find the correct floor, solving current mis-alignment when Mario jumps on moving objects.
development_findings.quote: My idea for the shadows is that it's actually going to be a whole separate object, separate from Mario … that way it will be all fine.

development_findings.summary: Elevator is implemented physically rather than teleporting the player for simplicity; camera shake and FOV shake are being tuned to feel right without looking bugged.
development_findings.quote: Why did you make the elevator actually move instead of teleporting the player?  Why not? It's just easier.

development_findings.summary: n-prim pipeline mode was enabled, requiring small dialogue fixes and giving ~1 FPS gain; shows continued micro-optimisation habit.
development_findings.quote: As long as you do your pipe syncs correctly, you should be able to just use n-prim … It was like 1 FPS or so.

development_findings.summary: Anti-aliasing now runs in real time on console hardware; still blurry and slightly broken at <30 FPS, so further work is planned.
development_findings.quote: Well, I never claimed it's perfect on console … it's not perfect yet on console, it's gonna be perfect I hope.

development_findings.summary: Plan to port Return-to-Yoshi’s-Island performance optimisations back to vanilla SM64 as an open-source project once ESO is finished.
development_findings.quote: After ESO is done I'll likely start an open source project … port back all of the RTYI optimizations to vanilla Mario 64.

development_findings.summary: ROM size will stay within the original 64 MB limit to remain authentic to N64 constraints.
development_findings.quote: If the games back then used 64 megabytes, I'm not going to go more than that … If I don't stay within the original limitations, am I not kind of cheating?

development_findings.summary: Upcoming public Course 1 demo will ship with a Google Form to collect granular feedback on physics and camera.
development_findings.quote: I'm gonna have a demo of course one … ideally what I want is to get as much feedback as possible so I can make minuscule adjustments.

development_findings.summary: Video content pipeline: Kaze recorded narration for a ‘random matrices’ video and hired an editor at $16 per finished minute to raise production quality and save development time.
development_findings.quote: I recorded the voiceover today and there's someone who wants to help me edit … hopefully we have a higher quality video this time and hopefully that saves me a lot of time.

context_findings.summary: Kaze openly feels mentally foggy and tired, partly due to daily swimming sessions with Zeina.
context_findings.quote: I don't know what's up with me today, but I'm not feeling mentally clear … we went swimming so much this week.  Maybe that's why I'm feeling so tired.

context_findings.summary: He expects the birth of his daughter Reyna within five days and may pause streaming around the delivery.
context_findings.quote: Just so you guys know, in five days, my daughter is likely going to be born, meaning I might not be able to stream next week.

context_findings.summary: Reflects on past social isolation (four years with almost no verbal interaction) and its psychological effects, linking it to valuing small pleasures.
context_findings.quote: For like four years I just lived by myself alone without ever talking to anyone … you just start appreciating the smallest things.

context_findings.summary: Expresses philosophy that abiding by hardware limitations and avoiding excess stimulation fosters creativity.
context_findings.quote: People don't enjoy being bored enough … I don't want to finish the game and then people are like, oh yeah, but you used more memory though.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration with Nintendo: 70 of his videos were DMCA-takedown, yet remains determined to continue modding.
context_findings.quote: They took down 70 of my videos, just so you are aware of how much they hate me.

biobak.summary: Reviews Kaze’s models after initial pass and improves visual quality.
biobak.quote: Whenever I'm done with the model, [Biobak] looks over it again and makes it look a lot better.

badub.summary: Composes music for the hack and is cited as current music contributor.

zeina.summary: Creates most of the new animations and supplies concept art; personal life overlaps as Kaze’s spouse and mother of upcoming child.
zeina.quote: Oh yeah, animations are the biggest one she's doing.

key_stories.title: Fixing the Shadow Bug
key_stories.summary: Mario’s shadow slips off moving platforms.  Kaze decides the shadow must be separated into its own object that independently queries floor collision data and follows Mario.
key_stories.challenge: Shadow alignment breaks on elevators and objects.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed live and settled on spawning a discrete shadow entity instead of re-using Mario’s footprint logic.
key_stories.outcome: Implementation plan formed; coding deferred to later stream.
key_stories.key_quote: My idea for the shadows is that it's actually going to be a whole separate object, separate from Mario, so it can have a different floor.

key_stories.title: Elevator Shake Tuning
key_stories.summary: A new elevator in Snowman Cave felt disorienting.  Kaze tweaked magnitude, pitch and FOV shake live, debating whether to keep only camera shake.
key_stories.challenge: Initial shake looked like a bugged camera and started too early.
key_stories.process: Added tiny settings, removed FOV shake, iteratively tested on console.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on gentler camera shake; sound effect still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: The FOV shake kind of makes this look like a bugged camera, doesn't it?

key_stories.title: Nintendo’s 70 Video Takedown
key_stories.summary: Kaze recounts how Nintendo DMCA-struck roughly 70 of his videos because of Mario mods.
key_stories.challenge: Loss of significant channel content and visibility.
key_stories.process: No formal appeal; accepted strikes but uses them as motivation to keep modding.
key_stories.outcome: Continues development but remains cautious about future releases.
key_stories.key_quote: They took down 70 of my videos … they fucking hate me.

key_stories.title: Imminent Fatherhood Pause
key_stories.summary: With daughter Reyna due in five days, Kaze prepares the community for a potential stream hiatus.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing game development/streams with family obligations.
key_stories.process: Announced timeline and contingency on stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I might not be able to stream next week because we might still be in the hospital.

open_questions.context: Kaze outlined the concept but not the technical details or timeline.
questions: How exactly will the shadow object query floors?
Will it impact performance on real N64 hardware?
Is this approach reused for other characters?

open_questions.context: AA works but appears blurry and broken below 30 FPS.
questions: What remains to reach ‘perfect’ quality on console?
Is there a performance budget for AA in later levels?

open_questions.context: He plans a Google Form but gave no detail on duration or adoption of feedback.
questions: What metrics will decide physics/camera changes?
How long will the demo be available?

open_questions.context: Badub is composing, but no style or references were discussed.
questions: What mood or instrumentation does Kaze envision?
How will music react to slide vs. void sections?

open_questions.context: Biobak ‘makes it look a lot better,’ but workflow isn’t described.
questions: What tools and file formats are shared between Kaze and Biobak?
How many revision passes does each model receive?
